Reference

onion.IonFrame

class onion.IonFrame(dt, position, nside=128, dbot=60, dtop=90, ndlayers=10, fbot=150, ftop=500, nflayers=30, _pbar=False, _autocalc=True)

A model of the ionosphere for a specific moment in time. Given a position, calculates electron density and temperature in the ionosphere in all visible directions using International Reference Ionosphere (IRI) model. The calculated model can estimate ionospheric attenuation and refraction in a given direction defined by elevation and azimuth angles.

Parameters

  • dt (datetime) – Date/time of the model.

  • position (Tuple[float, float, float]) – Geographical position of an observer. Must be a tuple containing latitude [deg], longitude [deg], and elevation [m].

  • nside (int, default: 128) – Resolution of healpix grid.

  • dbot (float, default: 60) – Lower limit in [km] of the D layer of the ionosphere.

  • dtop (float, default: 90) – Upper limit in [km] of the D layer of the ionosphere.

  • ndlayers (int, default: 10) – Number of sub-layers in the D layer for intermediate calculations.

  • fbot (float, default: 150) – Lower limit in [km] of the F layer of the ionosphere.

  • ftop (float, default: 500) – Upper limit in [km] of the F layer of the ionosphere.

  • nflayers (int, default: 30) – Number of sub-layers in the F layer for intermediate calculations.

  • _pbar (bool, default: False) – If True - a progress bar will appear.

  • _autocalc (bool, default: True) – If True - the model will be calculated immediately after definition.

IonFrame.atten(el, az, freq, _pbar_desc=None, col_freq='default', troposphere=True)
Parameters

  • el (float | np.ndarray) – Elevation of observation(s) in [deg].

  • az (float | np.ndarray) – Azimuth of observation(s) in [deg].

  • freq (float | np.ndarray) – Frequency of observation(s) in [MHz]. If - the calculation will be performed in parallel on all available cores. Requires dt to be a single datetime object.

  • col_freq (str, default: 'default') – Collision frequency model. Available options: ‘default’, ‘nicolet’, ‘setty’, ‘aggrawal’, or float in Hz.

  • troposphere (bool, default: True) – If True - the troposphere refraction correction will be applied before calculation.

  • _pbar_desc (str | None, default: None) – Description of progress bar. If None - the progress bar will not appear.

Return type

float | np.ndarray

Returns

Attenuation factor at given sky coordinates, time and frequency of observation. Output is the attenuation factor between 0 (total attenuation) and 1 (no attenuation).

onion.IonModel

class onion.IonModel(dt_start, dt_end, position, mph=1, nside=128, dbot=60, dtop=90, ndlayers=10, fbot=150, ftop=500, nflayers=30, _autocalc=True)

A dynamic model of the ionosphere. Uses a sequence of IonFrame objects to interpolate ionospheric refraction and attenuation in the specified time range.

Parameters

  • dt_start (datetime) – Start date/time of the model.

  • dt_end (datetime) – End date/time of the model.

  • position (Tuple[float, float, float]) – Geographical position of an observer. Must be a tuple containing latitude [deg], longitude [deg], and elevation [m].

  • mph (int, default: 1) – Number of static models per hour.

  • nside (int, default: 128) – Resolution of healpix grid.

  • dbot (float, default: 60) – Lower limit in [km] of the D layer of the ionosphere.

  • dtop (float, default: 90) – Upper limit in [km] of the D layer of the ionosphere.

  • ndlayers (int, default: 10) – Number of sub-layers in the D layer for intermediate calculations.

  • fbot (float, default: 150) – Lower limit in [km] of the F layer of the ionosphere.

  • ftop (float, default: 500) – Upper limit in [km] of the F layer of the ionosphere.

  • nflayers (int, default: 30) – Number of sub-layers in the F layer for intermediate calculations.

  • _autocalc (bool, default: True) – If True - the model will be calculated immediately after definition.

IonModel.save(directory=None, name=None)

Save the model to a file.

Parameters

  • directory (Optional[str], default: None) – Path to directory to save the model.

  • name (Optional[str], default: None) – Name of the file (extension is not required).

classmethod IonModel.load(path)

Load a model from file.

Parameters

path (str) – Path to a file (file extension is not required).

Return type

IonModel

Returns

IonModel recovered from a file.

IonModel.at(dt, recalc=False)
Parameters

  • dt (datetime) – Date/time of the frame.

  • recalc (bool, default: False) – If True - the IonFrame object will be precisely calculated. If False - an interpolation of two closest frames will be used.

Return type

IonFrame

Returns

IonFrame at specified time.

IonModel.atten(el, az, dt, freq, col_freq='default', troposphere=True, _pbar_desc=None)
Parameters

  • el (float | np.ndarray) – Elevation of observation(s) in [deg].

  • az (float | np.ndarray) – Azimuth of observation(s) in [deg].

  • dt (datetime | List[datetime] | np.ndarray) – Datetime of observation(s). If list - the calculation will be performed in parallel on all available cores. Requires freq to be a single float.

  • freq (float | np.ndarray) – Frequency of observation(s) in [MHz]. If - the calculation will be performed in parallel on all available cores. Requires dt to be a single datetime object.

  • col_freq (str, default: 'default') – Collision frequency model. Available options: ‘default’, ‘nicolet’, ‘setty’, ‘aggrawal’, or float in Hz.

  • troposphere (bool, default: True) – If True - the troposphere refraction correction will be applied before calculation.

  • _pbar_desc (str | None, default: None) – Description of progress bar. If None - the progress bar will not appear.

Return type

float | np.ndarray

Returns

Attenuation factor at given sky coordinates, time and frequency of observation. Output is the attenuation factor between 0 (total attenuation) and 1 (no attenuation).

IonModel.refr(el, az, dt, freq, troposphere=True, _pbar_desc=None)
Parameters

  • el (float | np.ndarray) – Elevation of observation(s) in [deg].

  • az (float | np.ndarray) – Azimuth of observation(s) in [deg].

  • dt (datetime | List[datetime] | np.ndarray) – Datetime of observation(s). If list - the calculation will be performed in parallel on all available cores. Requires freq to be a single float.

  • freq (float | np.ndarray) – Frequency of observation(s) in [MHz]. If - the calculation will be performed in parallel on all available cores. Requires dt to be a single datetime object.

  • troposphere (bool, default: True) – If True - the troposphere refraction correction will be applied before calculation.

  • _pbar_desc (str | None, default: None) – Description of progress bar. If None - the progress bar will not appear.

Return type

float | np.ndarray

Returns

Refraction angle in [deg] at given sky coordinates, time and frequency of observation.

IonModel.ded(el, az, dt, layer=None, _pbar_desc=None)
Parameters

  • el (float | np.ndarray) – Elevation of observation(s) in [deg].

  • az (float | np.ndarray) – Azimuth of observation(s) in [deg].

  • dt (datetime | List[datetime]) – Datetime of observation(s). If list - the calculation will be performed in parallel on all available cores.

  • layer (int | None, default: None) – A number of sublayer to calculate. If None - an average value over all layers will be calculated.

  • _pbar_desc (str | None, default: None) – Description of progress bar. If None - the progress bar will not appear.

Return type

float | np.ndarray

Returns

Electron density in [m^-3] in the D layer of the ionosphere.

IonModel.det(el, az, dt, layer=None, _pbar_desc=None)
Parameters

  • el (float | np.ndarray) – Elevation of observation(s) in [deg].

  • az (float | np.ndarray) – Azimuth of observation(s) in [deg].

  • dt (datetime | List[datetime]) – Datetime of observation(s). If list - the calculation will be performed in parallel on all available cores.

  • layer (int | None, default: None) – A number of sublayer to calculate. If None - an average value over all layers will be calculated.

  • _pbar_desc (str | None, default: None) – Description of progress bar. If None - the progress bar will not appear.

Return type

float | np.ndarray

Returns

Electron temperature in [K] in the D layer of the ionosphere.
